thread.title: UK Bank Trio Agree $924m Forex-Rigging Bill
thread.title_full: UK Bank Trio Agree $924m Forex-Rigging Bill

author: From sky.com
title: UK Bank Trio Agree $924m Forex-Rigging Bill
text: From sky.com Three of Britain's biggest banks were hit with a $924m (£600m) bill for foreign exchange‎-rigging on Thursday, adding to the spiralling cost of one of the industry's biggest trading scandals. Sky News understands that ‎Barclays, HSBC and Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS) agreed the figures during a US federal court hearing‎. ‎Barclays agreed to pay $384m, HSBC $285m and RBS $255m, according to people familiar with the settlements. The French bank BNP Paribas and Goldman Sachs, the Wall Street giant, agreed to pay $249m between them. The outcome is the latest in a string of claims brought on behalf of major ... (
